children.subject:
This might not be as helpful, since I ultimately didn't end up taking the fall internship I was offered. But here is my experience. 

When I accepted my summer internship, I was told that there was a good chance that they would want to keep me on part-time for the fall. And they did. If I had done this, I probably would have petitioned for a reduced course load (I have another PT job during the semester, so I would have been working 40 hours a week) and just taken a couple low-workload classes. I believe you don't pay as much tuition in this case. Other friends of mine who had fall internships had 6-month ones, so instead of being a standalone internship, they were more extensions of summer ones. So if you're still looking for a summer internship as well, then keep an eye out for the longer ones/ask about the possibility during your interviews. 

I've taken a semester off, and it wasn't a difficult process. So I'm sure taking off one semester is fine as long as you're in good academic standing. But if you'd like to take a class or two while working, and your job is close enough to Berkeley, then get a reduced courseload. I found that it was a bit hard to get back into the swing of things (i.e. working all day every day) once I returned to Berkeley, so keep that in mind. 

Some links (not sure if you are EECS or LSCS):

https://engineering.berkeley.edu/reduced-course-load

https://ls.berkeley.edu/advising/planning/enrolling/course-load-limits

https://engineering.berkeley.edu/academics/undergraduate-guide/policies-procedures/withdrawal

https://ls.berkeley.edu/advising/academic-progress/changing-status/withdrawal

history.content: I have done an off cycle internship before. There are sometimes separate job openings that are available to apply to, but what I did was get multiple offers for the summer and asked if any of them would be able to move me to fall/spring.

Summer internships are typically all I hear about but has anyone had experience getting one for the fall/spring and would like to elaborate on the process you took? In particular, I have these questions in mind:

1. I'm set to graduate in ~3 years if I don't try to do a fall/spring internship (I'm currently a sophomore). How does the process work when you do get a job during the school year? Would you have to "withdraw" for that semester, or is there a slightly different process so that you can get units while having the job? Will I have to pay any fees, or will I just pay essentially like half tuition for (as an example) when I return to Berkeley in the spring after a fall internship?

2. How do you find those roles? Whenever I try to search "fall software engineer internship" or something like that, most results seem to point me back to summer openings. Any advice for finding those?

Thanks!
history.subject: Advice on getting fall/spring internships?
